title: Remote Config - enable_ticketmaster_sdk - true
custom_preconds:
Prerequisite - 
Remote Config Setup for: Ticket Master configuration
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "enable_ticketmaster_sdk" as true
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.


Cloud Firestore: Individual Venue Ticket Master configuration
1. Go to Cloud Firestore (links below)
2. Select desired collection (based on environment) "ticketmaster-sdk-venues-*/env" 
3. Select specific document for desired team/venue (can be confirmed via 'description' and/or 'venueId')
4. Edit "enabled" as needed to force display


BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs 
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)
(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform/target_audience)

Cloud Firestore
[Ballpark(staging) - ticketmaster-sdk-venues-staging](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/firestore/data/~2Fticketmaster-sdk-venues-staging)


GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.6.0 or greater)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user selects a ticket from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN you should see the ticketmaster verified webview screen with login fields
![](index.php?/attachments/get/24281)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN FireStore configuration is updated: "ticketmaster-sdk-venues-*/enabled" boolean to "true" 
AND select a ticket from the specific TicketMaster venue
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN you should see the ticketmaster verified webview screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN FireStore configuration is updated: "ticketmaster-sdk-venues-*/enabled" boolean to "false" 
AND select a ticket from the specific TicketMaster venue
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN you should see the native tickets screen with a list of tickets

title: Remote Config - enable_ticketmaster_sdk - false
custom_preconds:
Prerequisite - 
Remote Config Setup for: Ticket Master configuration
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "enable_ticketmaster_sdk" as false
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.


Cloud Firestore: Individual Venue Ticket Master configuration
1. Go to Cloud Firestore (links below)
2. Select desired collection (based on environment) "ticketmaster-sdk-venues-*/env" 
3. Select specific document for desired team/venue (can be confirmed via 'description' and/or 'venueId')
4. Edit "enabled" as needed to force display


BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs 
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)
(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform/target_audience)

Cloud Firestore
[Ballpark(staging) - ticketmaster-sdk-venues-staging](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/firestore/data/~2Fticketmaster-sdk-venues-staging)



GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.6.0 or greater)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user accesses a ticket from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN you should see the native tickets screen with a list of tickets 
![](index.php?/attachments/get/24280)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN FireStore configuration is updated: "ticketmaster-sdk-venues-*/enabled" boolean to "true" 
AND user accesses a ticket from the specific TicketMaster venue
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN you should see the native tickets screen with a list of tickets

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN FireStore configuration is updated: "ticketmaster-sdk-venues-*/enabled" boolean to "false" 
AND user accesses a ticket from the specific TicketMaster venue
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN you should see the native tickets screen with a list of tickets

title: TicketMaster Account Login
custom_preconds:
Prerequisite - 
Remote Config Setup for: Ticket Master configuration
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "enable_ticketmaster_sdk" as true
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.


Cloud Firestore: Individual Venue Ticket Master configuration
1. Go to Cloud Firestore (links below)
2. Select desired collection (based on environment) "ticketmaster-sdk-venues-*/env" 
3. Select specific document for desired team/venue (can be confirmed via 'description' and/or 'venueId')
4. Edit "enabled" as needed to force display


BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs 
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)
(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform/target_audience)

Cloud Firestore
[Ballpark(staging) - ticketmaster-sdk-venues-staging](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/firestore/data/~2Fticketmaster-sdk-venues-staging)


GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.6.0 or greater)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN you change the RemoteConfig "enable_ticketmaster_sdk" boolean to "true" 
AND select a ticket from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN you should see the ticketmaster verified webview screen with login fields
![](index.php?/attachments/get/24281)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN logged into a tickermaster account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a webview of the TM venue page
AND user can access tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the TM ticket listview of the ticketed events page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps the logout button from TM venue page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the SDK should direct you back to the ticketmaster login page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM venue page displaying 'Sign in'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is maintained logged in to BP app with BP acct but logged out of TM account

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user is logged into BP acct
AND user is logged into TM acct
AND user has accessed TM tickets
WHEN user navigates to My Profile (via Home or More)
AND user taps Log Out
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN validate that you are logged out of the app and ticketmaster. 

Note: This can be accomplished by logging back in and selecting a ticketmaster enabled team and validating that the ticketmaster login page is visible.

title: Open TM enabled ticket from Home tab - Next Ticketed Event Card
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.6.0 or greater)
AND the Remote Config configuration for [enable_ticketmaster_sdk is set to true](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/1280831&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=1133732)
AND the Cloud Firestore document for the environment & particular venue configuration(ticketmaster-sdk-venues) is enabled and set to true

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has a ticket from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)
WHEN user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to Home tab

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be shown Next Ticketed Event Card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user examines the Next Ticketed Event Card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN startTime/startTIimeLocalText is displayed as day of the week, date, and local time of event is shown within the Next Ticketed Event(NTE) card

Example: 'Tue, Apr 20 - 7:00 PM ET'

AND title is shown of the game/non-game event within the NTE card

Example: 'Nationals @ Orioles' / 'Red Hot Chili Peppers'

AND description is displayed within the NTE card (if description provided in service call)

Example: '<Game Description>'

AND status is displayed within the NTE card (if statusText provided in service call)

Example: '2 tickets, 1 forwarded'

AND the background color of the NTE card is the primary color of the Venue's Home Team

Example: Orange color for Orioles (Camden Yards)

AND the background image of the NTE card is shown matching what is passed in the service call

Example: field/stadium image of the home team

[ONLY IF GAME EVENT - will the home team logo is shown. SKIP VALIDATION IF NON-GAME EVENT]

AND the home team logo is shown within the NTE card (if logoPngURL/logoSvgURL for specific OS provided in service call)

Example: 'Orioles team logo'

AND 'Open Tickets' button is shown attached to NTE card
AND the color of 'Open Tickets' text is the primary color of the Venue's Home Team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps the NTE card (above 'Open Tickets' button)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the listview of the tickets

Example deeplink: ballpark://listview?eventID=12345&teamID=109 (where the eventID and teamID match the appropriate event)

AND user is shown a webview of the TM venue page 
(a prompt stating Ballpark wants to use ticketmaster.com to Sign In could be shown, if not previously signed in)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the TM ticket listview of the ticketed events page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM listview of the ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to HomePage

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Open Tickets' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the scanview of the tickets

Example deeplink: ballpark://scanview?eventID=12345&teamID=109 (where the eventID and teamID match the appropriate event)

AND user is shown a webview of the TM venue page 
(a prompt stating Ballpark wants to use ticketmaster.com to Sign In could be shown, if not previously signed in)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user analyzes the tickets shown in the scanview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user can access tickets
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the TM ticket listview of the ticketed events page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM listview of the ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to HomePage

title: Open TM enabled ticket from Home tab - Forward Ticket Context Card
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.6.0 or greater)
AND the Remote Config configuration for [enable_ticketmaster_sdk is set to true](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/1280831&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=1133732)
AND the Cloud Firestore document for the environment & particular venue configuration(ticketmaster-sdk-venues) is enabled and set to true
AND TM clubs has enabled TM Transfer functionality

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has a ticket from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)
WHEN user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND has not logged into TM (nor previously accessed TM ticket)
AND user navigates to Home tab

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be shown Next Ticketed Event Card
AND user is shown forwardPrompt context card directly under the Next Ticketed Event card
AND the context card's has a button with text 'Forward Tickets'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user examines the Forward Prompt context Card 
AND user taps 'Forward Tickets' button within context card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is directed to listview with forward action sheet open
deeplink: ballpark://listview?eventID=65285&teamID=158&forward=true) teamID=hometeam for this event, eventID is associated ticket event

AND user is shown a webview of the TM venue page
(a prompt stating Ballpark wants to use ticketmaster.com to Sign In could be shown, if not previously signed into TM account)

AND user can access tickets
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets

('Transfer' button should be enabled with TM ticketview)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the TM ticket listview of the ticketed events page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM listview of the ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to HomePage

title: Open TM enabled ticket from Wallet tab
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.6.0 or greater)
AND the Remote Config configuration for [enable_ticketmaster_sdk is set to true](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/1280831&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=1133732)
AND the Cloud Firestore document for the environment & particular venue configuration(ticketmaster-sdk-venues) is enabled and set to true

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has a ticket from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)
WHEN user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to Tickets tab 

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be shown Ticketed Event Card on the WalletView*

*(if event is within next 6 events on the account, otherwise user must tap 'View All' to have My Ticket list presented with event shown in the list)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps the Event card (for the TicketMaster venue)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a webview of the TM venue page
(a prompt stating Ballpark wants to use ticketmaster.com to Sign In could be shown, if not previously signed in)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user analyzes the tickets shown in the scanview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user can access tickets
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the TM ticket listview of the ticketed events page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM listview of the ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to Wallet View within the Tickets Tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'View All' within WalletView on the Tickets Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown 'My Tickets' page with entries for each ticketed event associated with the account

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps the TM ticketed event
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown a webview of the TM venue page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user analyzes the tickets shown in the scanview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user can access tickets
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the TM ticket listview of the ticketed events page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM listview of the ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to'My Tickets' page within the Tickets Tab

title: TicketMaster Account Login - Multiple TM accounts
custom_preconds:
Prerequisite - 
Remote Config Setup for: Ticket Master configuration
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "enable_ticketmaster_sdk" as true
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.


Cloud Firestore: Individual Venue Ticket Master configuration
1. Go to Cloud Firestore (links below)
2. Select desired collection (based on environment) "ticketmaster-sdk-venues-*/env" 
3. Select specific document for desired team/venue (can be confirmed via 'description' and/or 'venueId')
4. Edit "enabled" as needed to force display


BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs 
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)
(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform/target_audience)

Cloud Firestore
[Ballpark(staging) - ticketmaster-sdk-venues-staging](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/firestore/data/~2Fticketmaster-sdk-venues-staging)
custom_steps:
GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.6.0 or greater)
AND the user has at least 2 different TicketMaster ticketed events at different TicketMaster venues

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has a ticket from a TicketMaster venue A (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)
AND user has a ticket from a TicketMaster venue B* (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)


WHEN user taps venue A ticketed event 
AND user is logged into the TM account for team A


*different from venue A

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a webview of the TM venue A page
AND user can access tickets for event A

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the TM ticket listview of the ticketed events page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the TM venue page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to BP app page (either Home Page or Tickets Tab, respective of where originally accessed event from within BP)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps venue B ticketed event
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN TM login page is presented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user logs into the TM account for team B
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a webview of the TM venue B page
AND user can access tickets for event B

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user dismisses the TM scanview of the tickets
AND user dismisses the TM venue page
AND user re-accesses venue B ticketed event within BP (home page or tickets tab)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the team B TM account should stay logged in
AND user is shown a webview of the TM venue B page
AND user can access tickets for event B
AND the team A  TM account should be logged out by showing the TM login screen when selecting a team A ticket

title: Forward a ticket within the SDK experience
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.6.0 or greater)
AND the Remote Config configuration for [enable_ticketmaster_sdk is set to true](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/1280831&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=1133732)
AND the Cloud Firestore document for the environment & particular venue configuration(ticketmaster-sdk-venues) is enabled and set to true

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has multiple tickets from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)
WHEN user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to Home tab

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be shown Next Ticketed Event Card
AND user is shown forwardPrompt context card directly under the Next Ticketed Event card
AND the context card's has a button with text 'Forward Tickets'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Forward Tickets' button within context card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is directed to listview with forward action sheet open
deeplink: ballpark://listview?eventID=65285&teamID=158&forward=true) teamID=hometeam for this event, eventID is associated ticket event

AND user is shown a webview of the TM venue page
(a prompt stating Ballpark wants to use ticketmaster.com to Sign In could be shown, if not previously signed into TM account)

AND user can access tickets
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets 

('Transfer' button should be enabled with TM ticketview)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Transfer' button within TM My Tickets webview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is presented the TM transfer ticket flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user successfully transfers TM ticket to another account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user(sender) no longer has access to the transferred ticket
AND the recipient of the transfer now has access to ticket via BP app

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has multiple tickets from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)
WHEN user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to Tickets tab

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be shown Ticketed Event Card on the WalletView*

*(if event is within next 6 events on the account, otherwise user must tap 'View All' to have My Ticket list presented with event shown in the list)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps the Event card (for the TicketMaster venue)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a webview of the TM venue page
(a prompt stating Ballpark wants to use ticketmaster.com to Sign In could be shown, if not previously signed into TM account)

AND user can access tickets
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets 

('Transfer' button should be enabled with TM ticketview)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Transfer' button within TM My Tickets webview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is presented the TM transfer ticket flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user successfully transfers TM ticket to another account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user(sender) no longer has access to the transferred ticket
AND the recipient of the transfer now has access to ticket via BP app

title: Cancel pending transfer within the SDK experience
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.6.0 or greater)
AND the Remote Config configuration for [enable_ticketmaster_sdk is set to true](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/1280831&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=1133732)
AND the Cloud Firestore document for the environment & particular venue configuration(ticketmaster-sdk-venues) is enabled and set to true
AND user has at least one TM ticket in pending forward state

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has multiple tickets from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)
AND user has at least one TM ticket in pending forward state
WHEN user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to Home tab

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be shown Next Ticketed Event Card

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user examines the Next Ticketed Event Card
AND user taps 'Open Tickets' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND user is shown a webview of the TM venue page
(a prompt stating Ballpark wants to use ticketmaster.com to Sign In could be shown, if not previously signed into TM account)

AND user can access tickets
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets 

('Transfer' button should be enabled with TM ticketview)
AND user is shown at least one TM ticket in Pending Forward state

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Cancel Transfer' link within the pending transfer via TM webview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a confirmation prompt with title "Are you sure you want to reclaim this ticket?"
AND the prompt shows 'Yes' and 'No' options

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'No' within the reclaim ticket confirmation prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the reclaim confirmation prompt is removed
AND the status of the ticket remains in Pending Transfer status

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Cancel Transfer' link within the pending transfer via TM webview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a confirmation prompt with title "Are you sure you want to reclaim this ticket?"
AND the prompt shows 'Yes' and 'No' options

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Yes' within the reclaim ticket confirmation prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the reclaim confirmation prompt is removed
AND the status of the ticket should update to Active (no longer shown in Pending Transfer status)

title: From previous BP/TM version to latest BP/TM version, Forward a ticket within the SDK experience
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the application has the TicketMaster SDK embedded
AND the user a previously released Ballpark app installed
AND the Remote Config configuration for [enable_ticketmaster_sdk is set to true](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/1280831&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=1133732)
AND the Cloud Firestore document for the environment & particular venue configuration(ticketmaster-sdk-venues) is enabled and set to true

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN sending user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app(prev release)
AND sending user has multiple tickets from the a TicketMaster venue (i.e Yankees, Braves, or Mariners)
WHEN user accesses* TM ticket


*accessing TM via BP can be achieved many ways:
** Home Page > Next Ticketed Event Card
** Home Page > Forward Context Card
** Tickets Tab > Event Card within initial WalletView
** Tickets Tab > View All > Ticket list 

[TicketMaster Venues](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226947/Ticketmaster+SDK#TicketmasterSDK-TicketmasterClubsandSDKStatus)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a webview of the TM venue page
(a prompt stating Ballpark wants to use ticketmaster.com to Sign In could be shown, if not previously signed into TM account)

AND user can access tickets
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets 

('Transfer' button should be enabled with TM ticketview)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Transfer' button within TM My Tickets webview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is presented the TM transfer ticket flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user successfully transfers TM ticket to another account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user(sender) no longer has access to the transferred ticket
AND the recipient of the transfer now has access to ticket via BP app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN receiving user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app(current/proposed release)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN receiving user should have the transferred ticket

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user accesses* TM ticket

*accessing TM via BP can be achieved many ways:
** Home Page > Next Ticketed Event Card
** Home Page > Forward Context Card
** Tickets Tab > Event Card within initial WalletView
** Tickets Tab > View All > Ticket list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a webview of the TM venue page
(a prompt stating Ballpark wants to use ticketmaster.com to Sign In could be shown, if not previously signed into TM account)

AND user can access tickets
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets 

('Transfer' button should be enabled with TM ticketview)

title: Listview

AND the user has TicketMaster account
